lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/bot.Chicken.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run bot.Chicken.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'

To list all your items, use the command:
This will display all items you currently have.
To mark an item, use the command:
This will mark the specified item as completed.
To delete an item, use the command:
This will delete the specified item.
To mark an item, use the command:
This will unmark the specified item.
Data in every session is automatically saved and retrieved from "data.txt" file
* The Chicken class serves as the main entry point for the bot application.
* It handles user interaction, file management, and task management by using other classes.
* The class initializes the necessary managers and the parser to process commands.

private final FileManager chickenFileManager = new FileManager("data");
private final Parser parser = new Parser(chickenManager, chickenFileManager);
